derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb): probably from Middle Dutch klinken
early 16th cent. (originally denoting a prison in Southwark, London): of unknown origin

entry.def: If objects made of glass, pottery, or metal clink or if you clink them, they touch each other and make a short, light sound.

example.ex: She clinked her glass against his...

means.word_mean: 2. a correctional institution used to detain persons who are in the lawful custody of the government (either accused persons awaiting trial or convicted persons serving a sentence)
1. make a high sound typical of glass;

sentences.sentence: "champagne glasses clinked to make a toast"

means.word_mean: 2. make or emit a high sound;
